citation.article-title: Eight new species of the genus Micromonospora, Micromonospora citrea sp. nov., Micromonospora echinaurantiaca sp. nov., Micromonospora echinofusca sp. nov. Micromonospora fulviviridis sp. nov., Micromonospora inyonensis sp. nov., Micromonospora peucetia sp. nov., Micromonospora sagamiensis sp. nov., and Micromonospora viridifaciens sp. nov.

p.s: (sa.ga.mi.en’ sis. N. L. adj. sagamiensis referring to Sagami Bay)

Color of substrate mycelium is pastel coral red (RAL 3016) on media ISP 2, salmon pink (RAL 3022) on ISP 3, pastel antique pink (RAL 3014) on ISP 4 and 7, tomato red (RAL 3013) on ISP 5, and no growth occurs on medium ISP 6.
Carbohydrate utilization pattern is indicated in Table 2.
Positive (APIZym) for leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, N-acetyl-β-glucoseamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase and β-glucosidase.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C8), phosphatase acid and α-glucosidase; negative for esterase (C4), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, naphtol-AS-bi-phosphohydrolase, β-glucoronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; diagnostic sugars are xylose and glucose; MK-9 (H4) is the principal menaquinone; diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine.
The fatty acids are given in Table 3.
16S rRNA gene accession number is X92624.
Type strain DSM 43912T, JCM 3310T, ATCC 21826T, NRRL 11334T.
